channel.title: Tea With Alice
channel.itunes:subtitle: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:summary: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With a rotating cast of bright and brilliant guests.
channel.description: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With a rotating cast of bright and brilliant guests.

item.title: David Rose - Offensively JewishCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
David Rose is a comedian and documentarian, talking with me about his ancestor, a Jewish comedian who played a caricature jew. We discuss offense, progress, context, hate speech and the function of minorities mocking themselves.
Find David on twitter and instagram at @davidrosecomedy
item.description:
David Rose is a comedian and documentarian, talking with me about his ancestor, a Jewish comedian who played a caricature jew. We discuss offense, progress, context, hate speech and the function of minorities mocking themselves.
Find David on twitter and instagram at @davidrosecomedy

item.title: Mitch Alexander - LandCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Mitch Alexander of Not Good Enough talks about revolution, landlords and capitalism.
Find him online at @notgoodpod
item.description:
Mitch Alexander of Not Good Enough talks about revolution, landlords and capitalism.
Find him online at @notgoodpod

item.title: Ash Fontana - PastCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
A time travel episode with the wonderful Ash Fontana - Angel Investor and all round business wizard, talks to me over mint tea. Before the pandemic!
How much to struggle, and how not to get caught up in questioning big life choices. Intellectual Honesty. Community. Ambition. Competency. Success.
Find Ash at @ashfontana on instagram and twitter
item.description:
A time travel episode with the wonderful Ash Fontana - Angel Investor and all round business wizard, talks to me over mint tea. Before the pandemic!
How much to struggle, and how not to get caught up in questioning big life choices. Intellectual Honesty. Community. Ambition. Competency. Success.

item.title: Tegan Higginbotham - Erotica RedemptionCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Tegan Higginbotham is a writer, presenter, comedian and friend of the podcast. We talked genre fiction and the chilling effect of online discourse.
@teganmh

Tegan Higginbotham is a writer, presenter, comedian and friend of the podcast. We talked genre fiction and the chilling effect of online discourse.

item.title: Gary Michael Anderson - Biracial ParenthoodCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Gary Anderson is an LA based comedian and friend - we talk about the politics of parenting, race and conservative commentary.
item.description: Gary Anderson is an LA based comedian and friend - we talk about the politics of parenting, race and conservative commentary.

item.title: Sami Shah - VoiceCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Sami Shah, author, broadcaster and comedian, talks about the problem with getting the dream job, what he wants to say and what it's like getting hate mail from white supremacists AND the Taliban.
item.description: Sami Shah, author, broadcaster and comedian, talks about the problem with getting the dream job, what he wants to say and what it's like getting hate mail from white supremacists AND the Taliban.

item.title: Mike Schmidt - RiotCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Mike Schmidt is an old friend from America, and living in the midst of the chaos there. We talked about news, standup, riots, racism and failure.
item.description: Mike Schmidt is an old friend from America, and living in the midst of the chaos there. We talked about news, standup, riots, racism and failure.

item.title: Chris Mancini - White CatCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Chris Mancini is a friend of the podcast, and there's one day left on his new kickstarter. We talked about failure, storytelling, fantasy and starting businesses in a pandemic.
item.description: Chris Mancini is a friend of the podcast, and there's one day left on his new kickstarter. We talked about failure, storytelling, fantasy and starting businesses in a pandemic.

item.title: Nato Green - UnionCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Nato Green is a Union Organiser, comedian and Bugle Cohost. I spoke to him about people power, his drink cart aesthetic, and whether the world can really be changed.
item.description: Nato Green is a Union Organiser, comedian and Bugle Cohost. I spoke to him about people power, his drink cart aesthetic, and whether the world can really be changed.

item.title: Corey Tutt - Deadly ScienceCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Corey Tutt is a scientist, Kamilaroi man and I spoke to him about the things he wrestles with as a scientist, as an indigenous Australian and some of the difficult things that brought him to the decision to create DeadlyScience, an initiative that provides science books and early reading material to remote schools in Australia. Corey's the 2020 NSW Young Australian of the Year, which is pretty fancy, but we had a lovely chat.
item.description: Corey Tutt is a scientist, Kamilaroi man and I spoke to him about the things he wrestles with as a scientist, as an indigenous Australian and some of the difficult things that brought him to the decision to create DeadlyScience, an initiative that provides science books and early reading material to remote schools in Australia. Corey's the 2020 NSW Young Australian of the Year, which is pretty fancy, but we had a lovely chat.

item.title: Emma Gatti - ScienceCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: I spoke to NASA scientist, Vulcanologist and Science Educator, Emma Gatti about science, communication, Italy and Mona Lisa Bytes. Find Emma's new project at monalisabytes.com

item.title: Maddie King - ImmuneCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Maddie King is a bright and gorgeous 19 year old student, who was looking forward to coming out of her cancer treatment into a world where she could go out with friends again. We talk over extremely pretentious teas about priorities, self worth and growth.
Find Maddie on instagram @mxddieking

item.title: Aaron Simmonds - PowerCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
World champion powerlifter and comedian, Aaron Simmonds sits with me in my flat in London over a Hot Ribena (!) and talks international sporting achievement, the ups and downs of the nickname 'hot-wheels', pride and being able to queue jump in his wheelchair.
Find Aaron Simmonds online on twitter at @rollingcomedian

I'm at http://patreon.com/alicefraser

item.title: Airless CarCast - Claire Hooper and Women of Letters
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Running out of Oxygen, but still full of ideas.
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in a car with Claire Hooper in the carpark of Splendour in The Grass. As they slowly run out of oxygen, they talk about anxiety, what's the point of the news, the ethical downsides of being right about anything, Alice's million dollar idea, and how Claire as a new mother feels sorry for Pedophiles.
Appended at the end is Alice's Women of Letters performance, for people who don't mind sad things that aren't funny.
Thanks to Bryce Halliday for the Audio Edit. http://brycehalliday.com Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com Claire is at http://clairehooper.com

item.title: CapperCast Teacast - Nick Capper
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Values and all that
item.itunes:summary:
In a cavernous cafe in Melbourne, Alice sits down with Nick Capper and talks about the value of value, whether we should be careful or not careful with what we say and a lot of other things.
This chat happened chronologically BEFORE last week's chat with Toby Halligan, so some of the ideas here are amoebic forms of what was discussed 'last week'. Ah, time travel.
Hit Alice up on alicerfraser@gmail.com or go to the website alicecomedyfraser.com

item.itunes:subtitle: The Political is Personal vs Generalities of Identity Politics

Toby is a writer for The Project, creater and facilitator of political comedy all over Australia and just a generally interesting and cool guy. They discuss giant sandwiches, scurrilous comedy scene gossip, identity politics and what's the best way to take offense.
Toby is online at www.tobyhalligan.com.au and Alice is available (as ever) on http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Tea's A Crowd or a Fourcast Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Adam Yardley, Fiona Yardley and Richard Parkin and A Baby and A Plane
item.itunes:summary:
Alice has tea and talks in a remarkably civilised fourway throwdown about violence and criminality. Chapter titles if you want to skip ahead or back are as follows:
4.50 minutes in Punching for no reason. 9.05 mins Gendered dreams [do babies dream of electric babies?]. 13.20 Aggression as a problem solving tool, violent fantasies and masculine heroism. 17 mins The righteous smashing! 20 mins A heavily visual joke 21 mins - Swimming in salt water; complicated grief. 24 mins The transcendental beauty of the imperfect... 26 mins Criminality and Criminology. 30 mins No-one wants to be an arsehole? 33 mins - Passive Aggression is not that bad.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Quali-Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sweet mics and hot conversation
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice take tea and talk no regrets, secular churches, the idea of friends with benefits, left handed people, relationship evolution, theme parks and some other stuff.
Sean's back and the original teacast two slide a sweet sounding show smoothly into your ear holes.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com or subscribe on itunes

item.title: Trapped in an Industrial Fancast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sean Returns
item.itunes:summary: Despite the ominous 'womm wommm' noise, this tea was delightful and lighthearted. Sean and Alice have tea and talk about how having a broken headlight is like being cheated on, how Sean secretly doesn't want to sleep with every girl he dates. We discuss babushka dolls, when you want to be making risky decisions and how to be the master(bater) of your own destiny.

item.title: Tea with Greg Fleetcast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Bookshop Junkies
item.itunes:summary:
Alice and Greg Fleet have tea in a bookshop cafe. They talk flirting, punching Hitler, sympathy for pedophiles, anger management and how to destroy a friendship.
Look out for Greg Fleet at a comedy festival near you. Tickets available online.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: A Modest Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Swift and psychology, tea to the Max
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk over tea about how love is an addiction, bad investments, getting out while you're on top, and then play out an upsetting rant on a (non) alternative to the refugee crisis.
If you like the podcast, rate and review it on itunes, or recommend it to your friends. Visit Alice at - http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Love Me Tindercast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Taking a swipe at modern love
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice have tea and talk about compliments, modern love, disco-ball surgery and the worst kind of profiling.
Alice loves the idea of marriage, but wants to propose an alternative for people that are less certain about the 'as long as we both shall live' part.
subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it.
Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com
http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Twincast Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Double Trouble with the Fraser Twins
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks to her twin brother in a cafe in Oxford about criticism, self-doubt and the self indulgence of kickstarter.
Sean's offline again this week, so sound quality is Alice-style, and we're rocking a slightly late release.
see Henry's music at http://henryfraser.com subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it. Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com

item.title: Teacast all the way to the Bank
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Catfished by a Corporation
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk about how corporations aren't people too, how it's not good to get too close to your money, and how to avoid a spiral of liking that ends in marriage.
(slightly shorter than usual, as Alice is in England and cut out a thing and couldn't figure out how to replace it with another thing)

item.title: Teacast Art Imitating Lifecast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Third Time Lucky
item.itunes:summary: Sean tells a joke that you will never hear, Alice rants about whether art is or is not a luxury and the urge to create or play video games. They reflect on corporate life.

item.title: Teacast predator vs alienation
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's be Positive (about consent)
item.itunes:summary: Strap yourselves in. Alice educates Sean about dubious consent, they talk about smoke and mirrors, the jazz hands part of sex and what happens when a bird flies into the window.

item.title: Post Christmas Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Birth of the Gripes Child
item.itunes:summary: Alice has tea with Sean. They talk about pride, love and loss, and school. Alice rants about goodwill to all mankind, and Sean talks about breakups with a friend.
